sections.title: Introduction: Agents, multimodal models and UI styling goal
sections.summary: Presenter introduces working with agents (multimodal models) and states the goal of applying the SAVA brand style/colors to a Blazor web application. Notes that the current app is using a default/standard color set that needs replacement.
key_actions: Introduce multimodal agent capabilities
Identify current (non-SAVA) branding and color usage
Decide to apply repository-provided SAVA style assets

sections.title: Copying style assets and preparing inputs for Copilot/Compiler
sections.summary: Copy style file(s) and reference images from the repository and paste them into GitHub Copilot / Compiler context so the AI can use them as input for UI improvement.
key_actions: Copy style file from repository
Open GitHub Copilot / Compiler
Paste style file and reference images into Copilot context
Prepare a prompt asking the compiler to improve the UI

sections.title: Copilot analysis and implementation planning
sections.summary: Copilot/Compiler reads the project code, identifies the front-end structure (Blazor), locates CSS and component files, and forms a step-by-step plan to apply the SAVA styles to the application.
key_actions: Allow Copilot to scan repository files (CSS, component .razor files)
Copilot identifies where front-end changes are required
Copilot generates a multi-step plan for implementing style changes

sections.title: Applying CSS edits, handling running app popup, and initial reload
sections.summary: Copilot applies edits to app.css and other style files. Because the app is running a prompt/pop-up asks to stop the running application; presenter accepts changes and restarts/runs the app to observe initial style changes (some colors look off/dark).
key_actions: Copilot edits app.css (and possibly other style files)
Respond to popup asking to stop running application
Restart/run the Blazor application
Refresh browser to view applied changes
ui_elements: running application popup ('stop the running application')

sections.title: Iterative refinement via screenshots and further Copilot prompts
sections.summary: Because initial styling had readability issues (dark text/background), presenter takes a screenshot of the UI and pastes it into Copilot with a request to improve the view. Copilot analyzes the screenshot and makes additional changes. Presenter notes this can take several minutes and that smaller incremental changes are possible.
key_actions: Take a screenshot of the UI with visual issues
Paste screenshot into Copilot/Compiler with description
Ask Copilot to improve the specific view
Allow Copilot time to analyze and implement changes
Refresh page/hot-reload to see iterative updates

sections.title: Reviewing updated UI, testing product page and cart; note further iterations
sections.summary: After additional edits the presenter re-runs the app and sees improved contrast and product cards. They add products to the cart to test UI components and notice card layout and cart visuals still need improvement — highlighting that the process is iterative and Copilot can be asked for more refinements.
key_actions: Run application again to pick up latest CSS changes
Inspect product page and product cards
Add sample products to cart to test UI behavior
Identify remaining UI issues (card layout, readability)
Plan further Copilot-driven iterations

main_topics: Using AI agents (GitHub Copilot / Compiler) to modify front-end UI
Applying brand style / CSS updates in a Blazor application
Iterative UI refinement using screenshots and multimodal prompts
Hot reloading and running the Blazor app during development
Testing product page, cards and cart UI components
